title: Add homepage voting-results promo section plus voting widgets and admin-managed results

requirements.text: Add a new promotional section at the very top of the homepage (above the existing hero section) with the exact title text: "GRAM PRADHAN VOTING LIVE RESULT OF WHOLE VILLAGES AROUND JANGHAI COMMING SOON STAY TUNED WITH US...". The section must be visually prominent and clearly separated from the hero.

quotes: ADD NEW SECTOIN AND ALSO PROMOTE THIS SECTION IN FRONT PAGE  WITH THE TITLE OF GRAM PRADHAN VOTING LIVE RESULT OF WHOLE VILLAGES AROUND JANGHAI COMMING SOON STAY TUNED WITH US...

acceptanceCriteria: On the homepage, a new section renders above the current Hero Section.
The title text matches exactly (including capitalization/spelling) what the user provided.
The section is styled to be visually prominent (e.g., banner/card with strong typography) and responsive across mobile and desktop.

requirements.text: Implement a 'Live Results (Coming Soon)' results widget inside the new homepage section that can display vote counts per village/candidate from the backend and automatically refreshes periodically (polling) to simulate live updates.

quotes: “Generate a complete web SECTION that displays live voting results on a website.
It should include: • A frontend UI to show live vote counts dynamically updating.”

acceptanceCriteria: Homepage section includes a results UI that renders a list/table of villages and vote counts (or an empty-state when no data exists).
The widget refreshes results automatically at a fixed interval (e.g., every 5–10 seconds) without requiring a page reload.
Loading, empty, and error states are handled gracefully and are user-friendly in English.

requirements.text: Add backend support in the Motoko main actor to store and serve voting result data (villages, candidates, and counts) and expose public query methods to fetch results plus admin-only update methods to create/update/delete result entries.

quotes: “Generate a complete web SECTION that displays live voting results on a website.”

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes at least one public query method to retrieve the current voting results dataset used by the homepage widget.
Backend exposes admin-only shared methods to upsert and delete voting result entries (villages/candidates/counts).
Unauthorized callers attempting to modify results receive an authorization error/trap consistent with existing admin protections.

requirements.text: Add an Admin 'Voting Results' management plugin (new admin module) that allows admins to manage the dataset shown on the homepage results widget (add/edit/remove villages/candidates and update counts).
acceptanceCriteria: Admin sidebar includes a new menu item for Voting Results, visible only in admin mode.
Admin module provides CRUD UI for voting results with validation and clear English labels.
Saving changes updates backend data and causes the homepage widget to reflect updated data after the next refresh (or via query invalidation).

requirements.text: Add at least one additional 'plugin/widget' outside of the new voting section to satisfy the request for plugins elsewhere on the site, implemented as a non-invasive UI enhancement on the front page (e.g., a slim announcement ribbon or compact highlight card) referencing the same 'Coming Soon' message.
acceptanceCriteria: A second, distinct widget appears somewhere else on the homepage outside the new top voting section (not inside it).
The widget is responsive, does not break existing homepage layout, and uses English text.
The widget can be disabled/removed by code easily (encapsulated component), and does not require external services.

constraints: Do not introduce unsupported backend technologies (no Node.js/Express, Python/Flask, Firebase, external databases, or WebSockets/SSE).
Keep all backend logic in the single Motoko actor at backend/main.mo (single-actor architecture).
Do not modify any frontend files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
All user-facing text added/changed must be in English.
nonGoals: Implementing true real-time updates via WebSockets/Socket.IO or Server-Sent Events.
Building an end-user vote-submission system intended for secure elections (authentication/anti-fraud/one-person-one-vote guarantees).
